data.title: Whitworth University Review & FAQs
data.meta_description: Here's everything you need to know including actual tuition, admissions, school spirit, campus safety, graduate salaries and more.
data.text:
Whitworth University Overview

Whitworth University is a four-year, full-time, selective, lower transfer-in, higher education institution located in Spokane, WA. It has an enrollment of 2,293 undergraduate students. The admissions acceptance rate is 91.46%.

The average annual cost of attendance after financial aid is $25,823. Tuition is $47,590.00 without financial aid.

Whitworth University is a predominantly bachelor’s-degree granting school.

At Whitworth University, 78.76% of students return after freshman year (national average: 68%).

Whitworth University has a student-to-faculty ratio of 11 to 1.

Whitworth University Website

Whitworth University Admissions

For the incoming class in 2023, the acceptance rate was 91.46%.

SAT or ACT scores are considered but not required.

The average SAT score was 1187.0 for the incoming class of 2023.

The median ACT score was 25.0 for the incoming class to 2023.

Whitworth University Cost

The average annual cost of attendance after financial aid is $25,823.

The average tuition is:

$17,296, when family income is less than $30,000

$18,646, when family income is between $30,001 and $48,000

$22,006, when family income is between $48,001 and $75,000

$30,526, when family income is between $75,001 and $110,000

$33,543, when family income is more than $110,000

The average tuition shown here is based on the NET costs to students who receive financial aid. For the incoming class of 2023, 56.04% of students received a federal student loan and 32.43% of students received a Pell Grant.

Tuition is $47,590.00 without financial aid.

Whitworth University Net Price Calculator

Whitworth University Majors/Salaries

Whitworth University has academic offerings within the core majors listed below.

Please note that different schools classify majors differently, so it is best to view the school’s website to see the various programs it offers. See detailed information about the individual majors at Whitworth University here.

Whitworth University Diversity

The racial diversity of students who received financial aid at Whitworth University

American Indian/Alaska Native: 0.57%

Hispanic: 13.00%

At Whitworth University, 2.99% of undergraduate students are 25 years old, or older.

Whitworth University Frequently Asked Questions

How is school spirit at Whitworth University?

Whitworth University, located in Spokane, Washington, has a strong sense of school spirit among its students and alumni. Students often participate in various events that promote school spirit, such as homecoming week, sporting events, and leadership activities. The campus also features a vibrant student life with numerous clubs and organizations that cater to different interests and passions. Whitworth’s athletics teams, known as the Pirates, are highly regarded and cheered on by students, staff, and alumni. Overall, Whitworth University is known for its active and supportive community and a strong sense of school spirit.

What are some popular extracurriculars at Whitworth University?

Whitworth University offers a variety of extracurricular activities for its students. Some popular extracurricular activities at Whitworth University include athletics (such as football, basketball, soccer, and track and field), music ensembles (such as choir, band, and orchestra), theatre productions, student government, volunteer opportunities through community service programs, and a variety of student clubs and organizations covering a diverse range of interests (such as art, politics, environmentalism, and more). Additionally, Whitworth University offers outdoor recreation and adventure programs for students who enjoy hiking, rock climbing, skiing, and other outdoor activities.

How are the food choices at Whitworth University?

Whitworth University offers a variety of food options for its students. On campus, students can choose from several dining options, including a main dining hall, a grab-and-go market, a coffee shop, and a full-service restaurant. The main dining hall, called “The HUB,” offers a wide range of cuisine, including vegetarian and vegan options, and also has a salad bar, deli station, and grill. The grab-and-go market, called “Mind & Hearth,” offers quick snacks, drinks, and pre-packaged meals. The full-service restaurant, called “The Prow,” is student-run and offers fine-dining experiences to students and the public. Overall, Whitworth University takes care to provide a variety of healthy and delicious food options for its students.

Is there Greek life at Whitworth University?

Yes, Whitworth University has a Greek life presence on their campus. The university has several fraternities and sororities which are a part of the National Panhellenic Conference, National Pan-Hellenic Council, and the North-American Interfraternity Conference.

What is Whitworth University known for?

Whitworth University is known for its strong commitment to providing a high-quality liberal arts education with a Christian perspective. It is a small, private university located in Spokane, Washington, with an average class size of around 20 students. Whitworth offers over 100 undergraduate degree programs in areas such as business, education, humanities, natural sciences, and social sciences. The university has a reputation for academic excellence, with a graduation rate of over 80% and a focus on preparing students for leadership roles. Whitworth is also known for its commitment to community service and social justice, with opportunities for students to engage in service projects both locally and internationally.

What are the most popular school clubs at Whitworth University?

Whitworth University has a wide range of clubs and organizations catering to different interests. Some of the most popular clubs at Whitworth include: 1. ASWU (Associated Students of Whitworth University) 2. Outdoor Recreation Club 3. Flute Choir 4. Pep Band 5. Fellowship of Christian Athletes 6. Student Theatre Productions 7. International Club 8. Black Student Union 9. Anime Club However, there are many other clubs and organizations at Whitworth University. Students can also start their own clubs if they don’t find one that suits their interests.

Is the campus at Whitworth University safe?

Yes, Whitworth University has a very safe campus. The university takes security very seriously and has its own campus security force that is available 24/7. Additionally, the university has a number of safety measures in place, including emergency call boxes, security cameras and a campus-wide emergency alert system. Whitworth University is located in a safe residential area of Spokane, Washington and is known for its peaceful and tranquil surroundings.
